New Records: Virat Kohli will become the first batter to aggregate 750 or more runs in a single edition of the World Cup if he scores 39 more runs
The 2023 World Cup will become the first edition in history to witness 40 centuries if a batter scores a century in the final
Mohammad Shami and Adam Zampa can become the third and fourth bowlers to capture 25 or more wickets in an edition of the World Cup
Ravindra Jadeja can become the fourth left-arm spinner to take 30 or more wickets in the World Cup if he takes three more wickets
Ravindra Jadeja can become the sixth Indian bowler to capture 30 or more wickets in the World Cup if he takes three more wickets
Adam Zampa can become the seventh Australian bowler to capture 30 or more wickets in the World Cup if he takes three more wickets
David Warner can become the second opener to aggregate 1500 or more runs in the World Cup if he scores 30 more runs
Virat Kohli can displace Ricky Ponting as the second-highest scorer in the World Cup if he scores three more runs
Indian fielders, other than wicketkeepers, can become the third team in the World Cup to have taken 300 or more catches by fielders if they take four more catches
Virat Kohli can become the third fielder other than the wicketkeepers to pouch 20 or more catches in the World Cup if he takes one more catch
David Warner can become the fourth fielder other than the wicketkeepers to pouch 20 or more catches in the World Cup if he takes three more catches
Key Match Events: The first century by a batter in the India vs Australia title clash would be the 40th century in the 2023 edition
Virat Kohli has an aggregate of 711 runs in this edition and needs 39 runs to become the first batter to aggregate 750 or more runs in a single edition of the World Cup
Virat Kohli has an aggregate of 1741 runs in the World Cup and needs three more runs to displace Ricky Ponting as the second-highest scorer in the World Cup
Pre-Game Insights: India are pursuing a third World Cup title while Australia can claim a record-extending sixth crown
The stage is set for the blockbuster India vs Australia, ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 at Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad on Sunday, November 19, 2023

Miscellaneous Highlights: The 2023 World Cup will become the first edition in history to witness 40 centuries if a batter scores a century in the final
The 2023 World Cup will become the first edition in history to witness two bowlers capturing 25 or more wickets if Mohammad Shami and Adam Zampa reach 25 wickets each
